Comment: I play the opening I always use as Black against the King Pawn, the solid French Defence.
I play the opening I always use as Black against the King Pawn, the solid French Defence.
Unusual. Usually, White plays d4 to occupy and, temporarily, control the centre. This move is perfectly playable and will probably transpose into a Winawer Variation (2.d4 d5 3.Nc3 Bb4).

According to plan. Black almost always plays this move to challenge White's central gains, otherwise he risks being forced into passivity and cramp. An interesting option, it is worth mentioning, is 2...c5?!, which I value only as a move which confuses my opponent :-).
Transposing fully into the Winawer Variation.
Transposing fully into the Winawer Variation.

After 19...Rxd1 20.Rxd1, Black has a hanging f-pawn AND has lost control of the open d-file. Naturally I preferred to double up my rooks on the d-file and maintain defence on the f-pawn, even though it loses the h-pawn.
